<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-gcrootlowering-cpp-/lowerintrinsics">LowerIntrinsics</a> - This pass rewrites calls to the llvm.gcread or llvm.gcwrite intrinsics, replacing them with simple loads and stores as directed by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcstrategy">GCStrategy</a>. <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-gcrootlowering-cpp-/lowerintrinsics/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-gcrootlowering-cpp-/gcmachinecodeanalysis">GCMachineCodeAnalysis</a> - This is a target-independent pass over the machine function representation to identify safe points for the garbage collector in the machine code. <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-gcrootlowering-cpp-/gcmachinecodeanalysis/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

### DoLowering() {#a755b4fb8450994d9125dbcd317bc4fc0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool DoLowering (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcstrategy">GCStrategy</a> &amp; S)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Lower barriers out of existence (if the associated <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcstrategy">GCStrategy</a> hasn&#39;t already done so...), and insert initializing stores to roots as a defensive measure.

Given we&#39;re going to report all roots live at all safepoints, we need to be able to ensure each root has been initialized by the point the first safepoint is reached. This really should have been done by the frontend, but the old API made this non-obvious, so we do a potentially redundant store just in case.

Definition at line <a href="#l00204">204</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/gcrootlowering-cpp">GCRootLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">/// CouldBecomeSafePoint - Predicate to conservatively determine whether the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction could introduce a safe point.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137" lineLink="#a6ca4a195657130ed6e1819daa858a9f4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a6ca4a195657130ed6e1819daa858a9f4">CouldBecomeSafePoint</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The natural definition of instructions which could introduce safe points</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   - call, invoke (AfterCall, BeforeCall)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   - phis (Loops)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   - invoke, ret, unwind (Exit)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However, instructions as seemingly inoccuous as arithmetic can become</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// libcalls upon lowering (e.g., div i64 on a 32-bit platform), so instead</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it is necessary to take a conservative approach.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;AllocaInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) || <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;GetElementPtrInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) || <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;StoreInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;LoadInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// llvm.gcroot is safe because it doesn&#39;t do anything at runtime.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
